Reviews.Title: “I should have listened to the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: TominLA
Reviews.Content: Durley House provides spacious apartments in a wonderful location with a very nice staff. No doubt that it offered a great hotel experience for the English upper class at one time. Not any more. Whoever owns this hotel needs to make a lot of renovations if the extremely expensive rates are to be justified. (I may not have gotten the best rate, but at $700 a night, the apartment was vastly overpriced). The problem is that the hotel seems very old and only partially renovated. The furniture seems more yard sale than antique. Every time you open a drawer you wonder if it will close again, whether the knob will come off, whether it will just collapse. Contrary to some other reviewers I think the place was clean, but due to its age, it just looks dirty. They cleaned the carpets when my family was there, but they had the same dusty look after after procedure. The hotel keeps its AAA stars because of the services it offers, such as 24 hour room service, but frankly I think the owner would do better getting rid of the perks and just be a 3 start hotel at a more reasonable price. If Durley House wants to survive as expensive boutique class lodging, the owners really need to replace all the carpets and furniture. The portable air conditioners with hoses out the window need to be replaced by central A/C, or by something built in -- although if you look at the wiring closely, this might not be feasible (check behind the fridge!) . To add insult to injury they added a bag of pistachios to our charges after we departed (which we never consumed) but gracefully promised to remove the charge when I e-mailed to complain. But, of course, they actually never bothered to remove it. Not real classy. Square footage in this neighborhood is undoubtedly expensive, and they give you a lot of it, but in the end it is like staying in Grandma's house -- it is just feels run down feeling -- even the couches sag. Judging by the positive reviews, some people are very happy with the homey feel of Grandma's aging apartment that Durley House provides -- but if that is not your taste, you can do much better in London at a cheaper price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: 584Thomas_H
Reviews.Content: Durley House is the perfect apartment hotel in a very nice part of London. We enjoyed the warm welcome from the staff and after a day of shopping it was nice to just relax in the large suite. Our two-room suite was very comfortable with a nice atmosphere, the small kitchen was also very nice as you could do some basic cooking of your own. Durley House is a very british hotel which means it has an old-fashion feeling so if you are looking for a trendy design-hotel this is not the place. But if you look for a comfortable hotel in nice surroundings with large rooms this is clearly the place to stay at. We give our best recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at Durley House”
Reviews.Author: JWesty162
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (and our eight year old son) stayed for four nights in September 2011. The 'hotel' actually has suites rather than rooms and these are very spacious with kitchens. This was great for a family trip as restaurants were often busy. The continental breakfast which was included in our rate was very good and the fresh fruit in the evening was a nice touch too. The staff were efficient and quite friendly and were always asking if they could do anything for us and we appreciated the personal touch that so many bigger hotels lose. Durley House is very close to Sloane Square tube and a terrific location for exploring London. No grumbles really, we got what we expected and would return. Thanks Durley house!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will come back!”
Reviews.Author: Dace C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located with great shops and sights in the immediate vicinity. At the hotel, one is undisturbed and can be private. Room service is impeccable and every time you left the room was cleared. Special requests we made at the time of booking was accommodated to the last detail, -which is great when you travel with kids. The breakfast we ordered the night before arrived on time and it was set up in our living room by a very pleasant member of staff, and next morning he was very concerned that we did not eat all off our breakfast the day before (breakfast are very large),and we where offered a substitute. The staff was friendly and service minded. The hotel makes reservations at restaurants, if one wants it. Defiantly one of the best places I have stayed in London. Will defiantly come back to stay at Durley House. Thank you very much Durley House team for a very wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away - Dirty Old Overpriced Hostel”
Reviews.Author: Hadi12
Reviews.Content: Please stay away from that hostel! Upon my check in I found that place very old and dirty! Was shown 3 different rooms. All were filthy, worn out, threadbare, an absolute slum rip off - Dirty carpets, smelly old furnitures, dirty bathrooms, broken lamp in the room, no portier! Just radicoulus for £600 a night!!! The photos on the website are very missleading! I must say it is absolutely the worse experience I have had in many years of traveling. Avoid at any cost!

Reviews.Title: “Old dirty and decadent”
Reviews.Author: AlbertoB1970
Reviews.Content: The site shows photos absolutely unreal. The building is old and decadent. Upon arrival they gave me another room, then I have moved to a different but with old furniture, still not what I had seen in the photo corresponds to my reservation. They tried to make me believe that moved me in a suite room, very expensive. Perhaps the room was luxurious, ...but twenty years ago !!!!! I was in London with two small children.!! Stayed only one night and after long negotiations they made me pay 50% of the rate of living, initially claiming the full amount. Hotel but needs a complete renovation, if it wants to pass himself off as a "Luxury Hotel ". Absolutely not recommended, see the photos! The bathroom was unwatchable, ask yourself why there are photos on the site !!! Staff not serious

Reviews.Title: “Great cosy hotel, with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: mokl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on one of London's most exclusive streets, offers a service and amenities that are above the price of the stay. Qualities of the suites are more than what you normally experience in London. Absolutely sure next to stay in London is at Durley House.

Reviews.Title: “a spacious and elegant hotel suite with excellent staff to match”
Reviews.Author: georgiemcd
Reviews.Content: After a long day shopping on Kings Road the spacious and elegant hotel suite was a great ending to the day. The rooms are beautifully decorated with antiques with a modern kitchen and bathroom. The suite over looked cadogan gardens and the street was surprisingly quiet. There was a tv and freeview in the sitting room and a dvd player in the bedroom. I have never slept so well in a hotel bed! We were also given free access to the Peak health and spa club 5 mintues away. The location is suburb with all the best shopping streets and tourist attractions only a few minutes walk away. The staff were very welcoming and helpful and we enjoyed a delicious breakfast in the suite brought up in the dump waiter and a butler to serve. Overall I highly recommend staying at Durley House because the staff, location and suite never fail. It is perfect for a weekend shopping or if you are up for business.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: nfhdp
Reviews.Content: Having a series of meetings in Knightsbridge I looked for a small friendly hotel in the area. Although Trip Advisor offered a series of very contrasting reviews I decided to try Durley House as its location is superb. My instincts proved correct and I found that Durley House met all my standards and then some. Extremely helpful and experienced staff, who, by the way, know the area and all it has to offer; pleasant suite with a small, equipped kitchen for a quick snack and with the possibility of having a meal sent up from the kitchens; great breakfasts served in your room, no buffet to confront you when you are only half functioning early in the morning; good modern conveniences like WIFI, Ipod loudspeakers and Sat TV. I can only thoroughly recommend Durley House for all those travellers, business or otherwise, who are looking for a Hotel with a great location and excellent service, without all the accompanying paraphenalia of one of the large chains, usually full of travelling groups.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, BIG aprtment!”
Reviews.Author: sunseeker701
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Durley House for four nights in January '11 with my partner. It's a fairly discreet building and you could miss it if just walking along Sloane Street, but someone met us at the door and we were checked-In quickly and shown to our Apartment. We were not disappointed either, it was huge! Nicely decorated in a traditional style with the added bonus of a kichen to do your own catering if you want. Our lovely big lounge enjoyed a view over Sloane Street. Best of all was the enormous comfy bed, exactly what you want after a hard days shopping! Had breakfast on two mornings and that was good too, we recommend the continental breakfast, the pastries were delicious. Friendly discreet staff who were always ready to help and they recommended us a great restaurant and made the reservation for us too. We don't come to London that much but will be back at Durley House next time we do.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE OF BED BUGS - DIRTY RUN DOWN HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: JRS1987
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Durley House Hotel recently and it was a terrible experience. I woke up on the first morning with 2 bites on my arm that i thought nothing of, then the second morning i woke with 25 bites all over my arms back and face, it was so bad i had to visit my doctor and take antibiotics to rid the swelling and infection. The doctor informed me that this was bed bug bites. We noticed our suite has not been thoroughly cleaned, there was food (chips) under the sofa and the furnishings were old and tired, the curtains also had stains on them and carpets rather dirty. I would not call this hotel Luxury in the slightest and the website is very deceiving! Beware - do not book this hotel! I work in travel and i would not send any of my clients near this hotel! it really does not resemble 4-5 star.

Reviews.Title: “billing fraud and dirtiness”
Reviews.Author: aysenaz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Durley House in this past November. First of all, the rooms are out of fashion, old looking and dirty. The staff made a wrong billing and forced us to pay it. She was really mean and rude...We did our payment with the hope of getting it back through 'customer services' but there was no response from them. On check out date, we were forced to pay a bill more than we agreed on mail and phone. We have tried to contact the 'customer services' for several times for incorrect billing. Nobody returned back to us. We are still searching for a way to get our money back but unfortunately there is no response. We have our mailing as a proof and we sent it to them but still no response. The money that we were forced to pay there was not worth for a dirty, old looking, bad maintained with a rude staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing localisation...”
Reviews.Author: pusior
Reviews.Content: We travelling with our 2 doughters we spent lovely time at Durley House breakfast are delicious....staff so helpfull and kind Good concierge ; )the place oposite gadogan garden..between the best shops......Recomend100%

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed Luxury and Centrally Chic...”
Reviews.Author: Andrew Alexander
Reviews.Content: We have recently stayed at Durley House on a family holiday with my partner, Mother and Nephew. We are quite well traveled and opt for first class air travel, 5 star hotels and do enjoy luxury thus we can be quite fastidious with accommodation and are fairly picky. We decided that the city of London demanded a boutique hotel and found Durley House situated in the middle of London on Sloane Street which is in the most wonderful central and not to mention completely chic location. We arrived late but were offered a complimentary beverage and shown to our suites without delay. This is an all suite boutique hotel and my Mother and Nephew were given a 2 bedroom suite which was rather huge by London standards and fully equipped with floor to ceiling windows from the elegant drawing room looking over the park. With a full kitchen, bathroom and two bedroom they were quite impressed. Whilst my partner and I had a one bedroom luxury suite which was most spacious again with kitchen and drawing room that again enjoyed views of the park opposite. This hotel is defenitely not modern day hi tech or minimalist and is more old world glamor at it's very best abound in history and delight. The bathrooms are well equipped with over sized towels and zen bathroom products whilst some may say they are dated I disagree and imagine that these are just how the bathrooms would be at Buckingham Palace, classically styled and fully functional with strong powerful showers which are great after a busy day in London. The Drawing room in our suite was ideal and the 4 of us had breakfast on our first morning delivered by the staff via a dumb waiter elevator in our suite, served on crisp white linen and consisting of pastries, toasts, selections of cheeses and meats, cappuccinos, orange juice, eggs Benedict and the most delicious pancakes! The internet worked well and was very fast as well as a selection of papers were provided each morning along with a full supply of current fashion, home and business magazines for you to read in the suite. The hotel foyer is small as one would expect but also has a very grand and comfortable reading library located to the right. Whilst Durley House may not be suited to everyone who may want modern technology and minimalist style this all suite hotel supplied us with the perfect home away from home whilst in London. We were most comfortable with more space than we required and completely central surrounded by style, shopping and sight seeing. The Hotel concierge even managed to book us a table for dinner at The Ivy with very short notice. We shall be using this hotel again when returning to London without a doubt as the space and comfort was such an indulgence for central London and at very good value!

Reviews.Title: “'Dirty' House contained shabby furniture falling to pieces...”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous7London
Reviews.Content: We had to move from the first apartment we were allocated because of a blocked toilet stuffed with loo paper; a really unpleasant 'welcome' showing housekeeping were not stringent. The place didn't feel clean at all - dusty and musty - and the furniture was shabby - we found one table was broken and another breakfast table / footstool collapsed under us. The apartment kitchens in particular were of a very poor and basic standard and very sparsely equipped - we had to ask for teabags and milk as we'd arrived late when all the shops were shut - there was no consistency of supplies. The breakfast was poor quality too - supermarket croissants and the juice not freshly squeezed but from a carton - not what you expect when paying this sort of money. We were simply not at all happy there and moved after a couple of days, having originally booked in for 2 weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!! The website paints a different picture.”
Reviews.Author: Europe_City_Explorer
Reviews.Content: Shabby, filthy, furniture dangerous and falling to pieces, a blocked toilet and questionable staff. These were the delights to welcome us upon check-in. The bathrooms are not clean and are in desperate need of complete modernisation as are the guest suites. A great shame because the location is fabulous. It is vastly over-rated and over-priced. In addition the meal we ordered was very poor. Please don't be deceived by the website.

Reviews.Title: “Your very own Sloane street Pied-a-terre....”
Reviews.Author: Shoeelf
Reviews.Content: Durley house could quintessentially become my own Sloane street Pied-a terre! Impressive with its 11 beautiful rooms it remained a soothing calmness and air of a private house. I was delighted to be greated by such a warm welcome after battling against the awful english weather! And was even more delighted to enter a beautifully spacious apartment complete with a kitchen! If like me you need privacy and space but still need to remain in the heart of London city then Durley House is a perfect pied-a-terre to call your very own.....well at least for a little while...!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the space and location..great for families.”
Reviews.Author: M00re4
Reviews.Content: I had read very mixed reviews about this hotel, but for our family needs (2 adults, 2 young children) it was perfect. The hotel does look as if it hasn't been touched since the 1980's-it's a bit like a time warp, but I thought it had a good feel to it. Traditional English style - antiques, huge oil paintings of men with moustaches, dumb waiters (not the human type!), etc. Facilities good - taps in bathroom could do with a re-chrome, but it's made of sturdy stuff - it's the actual space that we valued above all.. Staff very helpful and not intrusive. If you're into minimalist perfection and shiney surfaces then this isn't the place for you...but if you're after a relaxed stay in a great location with lots of space then I would highly recommend it. We stayed in the Durley Suite... I loved the huge sitting room area - you could do several cartwheels here if you wanted (not that we did) - ceiling to floor windows overlooking cadogan private gardens. Staff can give you a key ( and tennis racquets) for the gardens (two tennis courts and a play area for younger children ). Harrods down the road and Kings Road round the corner. Would come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there whatever you do!”
Reviews.Author: phantom007
Reviews.Content: The web sight made it look like a luxury hotel and nothing could be further from the truth: peeling wallpaper, stained carpets, worn armchairs set in a terribly dull and depressing decor. Hopeless staff, (I had to communicate with them about ten times before they got the dates right), but worst of all, dirty bathroom with rotting flowers in the vase. Boring menu and bizarre lighting. I found it a rip-off and felt cheated from the minute I walked in.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service but a tired "gem" in the West End”
Reviews.Author: SJB007
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a London hotel and booked Durley House via Lastminute.com as it had a nice description and was an excellent price for its prime location. Check in was excellent with fantasticaly helpful and friendly staff who sped us through the process and whisked us up to our room. We had booked a one bedroom suite / appartment (they are all suites / appartments but some have 2 bedrooms). The room itself was very clean and comfortable although a little "tired" in its decoration. Very large and comfortable bed! My only complaint would be the poor water pressure for the shower. We ate in our room and must compliment the hotel on its food. It was excellent. The wine is very resonably priced. Food orders are sent to the room via a dumb waiter and then served by a member of the hotel staff. I would throughly recommend Durley House. The service is outstanding and the location is excellent. If they redecorated this would be a truley outstanding place to stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “World Traveller”
Reviews.Author: jjerome
Reviews.Content: A rather shabby property demanding high rates for what really should be priced for less. The food was terrible, apparently prepared by a gourmet chef but looked more like frozen food. Staff could not speak english or failed to provide sufficient support for enquiries and requests to speak to the manager. Honestly your better off going somewhere, i was rather frustrated by the lack of communication from head office after i complained via email. In short a terrible waste of money!

Reviews.Title: “Warning: Routine Maintenance Not Being Done and Not Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: olddominiontraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely on the decline and needs some MAJOR renovations if it wishes to bill itself as a "luxury" property. It appears as if no money has been spent on routine mantenance recently. We stayed in two different rooms and both had problems......broken window cords, holes in the wall where hardware had fallen out and wasn't replaced....places in the ceiling where there had been obvious water leaks which looked like they could fall in any minute...overall feeling that it wasn't very clean and worst of all, stinky sewer gas smell that came out of the bidet when the tub was emptied. They obvious have some major problems with upkeep. Would never stay here again despite great location near Sloane Square.

Reviews.Title: “A little paradise in the heart of London”
Reviews.Author: Jes-NewYork
Reviews.Content: In the last few years , have been traveled a lot to the Uk. I have a decent inclination for sophistication and high standards and I admit I love english styles, traditional and modern. I must disagree with some negative reviews I have seen lately about the Durley House Hotel in Sloane Street, London. I have stayed there for numerous times and I have found the place a little paradise of personalised service and friendlyness. In fact, I know that I have been literally a pain, in asking for help in different occasions and the staff and management was incredibly helpful and accurate. I can't count the times I have visited since last year and already 2007, but I can't wait for the opportunity to be able to bring my family and friends, as I have felt like home and would love to enjoy london with them in a place like this

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but Tired”
Reviews.Author: vinmaker
Reviews.Content: Have stayed a couple of times due to the great location on Sloan St. Rooms are good size but need updating. The staff is friendly but not well trained. They are not knowledgeable about London restuarants, have some difficulty making dinner reservations or obtaining theater tickets. With better management and some improvement in decor, this place would be great.

Reviews.Title: “There are better places to go”
Reviews.Author: PRESItaly
Reviews.Content: Very nice home atmosphere, staff is very attentive and welcoming, but: -rooms facing Sloane street are noisy -in my room (7) air conditioner was not working; they gave me a portable conditioner, but it was just enough to freshen the bedroom. Temperature was terribly hot, mainly beacause of the many hot water tubes under the floor -forniture is quite old, needs to be changed -TVs are terrible: 14" old models; they could afford buying new ones -lack of restaurant at the end my stay there was not bad, but I wouldnt come back.

Reviews.Title: “a second home in central london”
Reviews.Author: welcometoedu
Reviews.Content: I was welcomed by the hotel manager, given a 2 room suite with fireplace, kitchen with a selection of wines and drinks, a great bathroom, big bed and they brought my breakfast every morning in my room. friendly staff and very professional, hotel is located in the heart of the city, next to all the luxury shops and 5 minutes walk from the tube. A second home, fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “The best service ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravels93
Reviews.Content: This is such a well kept secret that I feel reluctant to tell anyone else about it! Durley House is a five star "All suite" Hotel but in fact is more like having your own apartment in Sloane Street. My Suite was beautiful and had a very English feel (wonderful two bedrooms for the family); only slight complaint was that it needed new carpet as a few stains were quite large and visible. The real charm of this Hotel is the staff. Amazing! Never before has my family been made to feel more welcome and at home. Garrett spent more then 20 minutes on our arrival making sure that we had all the right restaurant choices and that we were as comfortable as possible. He was spot on all 6 times!! The whole place is amazing and is by far my best Hotel stay in all of my 40 years of Travel. Highly recommended!

HotelInfo.Name: Durley House
HotelInfo.Address: 115 Sloane Street, London SW1X 9PJ, England
